name: deimosrising
text: As it turns out, Pat would indeed know something so beautiful, in time.

name: vermy
text: Heavy foreshadowing here

name: atmus
text: He still won't know it.  Just because he turns gay doesn't mean he will ever get laid.  This is because Pat's a dick.

name: vermy
text: But everyone needs a project!

name: laserblade
text: Rod Huggins, as it turns out, is into dicks.  Which makes sense, given that he's gay.

name: atmus
text: Wouldn't that mean that dicks are into him?  He is a gay man, not a catheter.

name: i_love_kate
text: URETHRAL STIMULATION.

name: utv
text: Please do not taint the days before Assetbar was concerned with the horrors of URETHRAL STIMULATION.

name: geysershitdick
text: Mr. Gary's pole is extremely smokable.

name: chaesar
text: It is of the hand-rolled variety

name: waddlerz
text: No, but it is chubby

name: dumase
text: oh man. too good. this should have a thousand chubbies.

name: direhaggis
text: Much like the postprandial with a finger's worth.

name: untilyouaresonude
text: Arthur's got weird ideas about romance.

name: saru
text: A comment left by saru was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by autrepoupee, rowboat, Axhoola, SpinyNorman, achilleselbow, gorrioncita)

name: achilleselbow
text: Was basketball equipment invovled?

name: achilleselbow
text: Saru, this is your mother. Get down off that high horse, I'm afraid you might fall and hurt yourself!

name: overmedicated
text: The dude is proud because he gets laid.

name: tonyhighwind
text: Dude is proud because he thinks of it as more than just getting laid, actually.

name: skviiier
text: whoa shit, when I read the first two lines of that I assumed you were a mother and I thought you were implying that you use loving, sensual acts of passion on your children to express your love for them

name: draykid
text: That would just be terrible.

name: dissembly
text: I thought he was saying that he was a mother in a lesbian relationship. I was all like, "yeah! You REPRESENT! Go the non-traditional families."

name: dusty
text: you both said "thought" as in past tense. Is there some normal way to read this cause that's the only two possible meanings I can find.

name: skviiier
text: I now take 'mother' to mean 'motherfucker' (but not literally cos that just busts open a whole new kettle of fish)

name: dusty
text: Oh ok, so he was probably non-literally using the shortened term motherfucker, in a sentence referring to motherhood. There could be a college class about trying to fully understand this comment.

name: jamers
text: I feel like this happens about once a week on NPR, but nobody is ever listening.

name: rogergs
text:
It would happen nightly on WBAI, but in a much more passive-aggressive, self-entitled, personal-is-political kind of way.

His name was Monroe.

name: spinynorman
text:
I'm really sort of worried that "sitting on a canary" is slang for something I don't know about.

I doubt if it's just grinding a small yellow bird into the seat of a chair with your asscheeks. It is difficult to imagine how someone could be "good" at such a thing.

name: tekende
text: Maybe Arthur farts a lot?

name: dybrar
text:
It means, in my mind, sitting on a small yellow bird without grinding it into bird-paste.

I will leave the reader to ponder the mechanics behind this, should he or she choose to.

name: zaratustra
text: The implication is that Arthur has previously displayed a general proficiency at sitting on things that might be usefully employed in normally unsittable objects such as canaries

name: petitegitan
text: Good thing you don't have to admit things such as 'murder' at support groups.

name: slalvation
text: Larry is my name, insurance is my game. Raping was another game of mine.

name: dougthehead
text: I love Achewood strips where horrible secrets come spilling out of the characters, who were saving them for blackmail material before they got mad.

name: stevegt500
text: A comment left by stevegt500 was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by tekende, mortshire, Dwilow, peterjoel)

name: deusoma
text: That line had me in tears.

name: centipede_damascus
text: I wonder if we'll ever see Mr. Gary.

name: fielding
text: Do you really think you want to see Mr. Gary?  I don't think you want to be in the kind of place you have to be in before you go to see Mr. Gary.  That place is decorated spartanly, its only noticable feature a sticker making falsified claims about barbers.

name: fielding
text:
Wait..."we"? Oh, Centipede Damascus...or perhaps I should say Centipede Damascii...how could I have been so blind?

You can find Mr. Gary if you only look.

At 715 Lomax.

Go. Leave me.

TO MY THOUGHTS.

name: centipede_damascus
text: Did something go wrong with your brain there dude.

name: zeal
text: Genius works in mysterious ways.  Leave him to it.

name: farqussus
text: i don't think you can decorate spartanly.

name: tekende
text: You can do anything you set your mind to.

name: farqussus
text: I can, but HE can't.

name: professorhazard
text: The fact that both Mr. Gary and AKKOLADE are so rarely seen in the comic has led my mind to wonder if they are, in fact, one and the same.

name: junko
text: Teodor's head had to be small in the last panel, but the fact that is so small and featureless is a perfect rendition of his state of mind when hearing this.

name: 1000hz
text:
Bar none, my favorite alt-text of all time.

"Smoking Mr. Gary's pole is so beautiful"

name: pwb
text:
God DAMN it! DAMMIT!
DAAAAAAMN IIIIIIIIIIIIIT!
FUCK THE WORLD!

pat's best dialogue ever imo

name: fineoakstructure
text: Great strip: Teodor's eyebrows slightly askew through most of the strip is the perfect look.  I always love to add a "FUCK THE WORLD!" to any moment of rising anger (be it mine or a friend's).  Also, the visual of the "basketball equipment" just makes the anonymous support group local that much more visceral...those things are always in some room at a YMCA or community center, aren't they?

name: dreamerman91
text: Pat the bigot on the radio: nothing like an outlandish opinion to highlight the ridiculous nature of a call-in

name: nessotron
text: Oh shoot, that's another thing trying to steal my brain. I fucking hate Philadelphia. Nothing is sacred.

name: cthulhu235
text: How on earth does sitting on a canary make you gay? I mean, since Arthur's gay I guess that's the first thing he'd think of if it's clear Pat's insinuating something but still... crazy.

name: _cheesekayke
text: Man, Mr. Gary has some terrible anger metaphors.

name: ezcmac
text: This cannot be allowable on the radio.

name: sp1derbaby
text:
...is what Pat would say if it was him who was listening to that tirade. Then he'd ring in and complain by shouting again .

Man, he's a dick.

name: atypicaloracle
text: Basically he is a furious gigantic zit on the asscheek of a person who is experiencing 'roid-rage.

name: cheezeburger
text: Pat's turning out to be the Nor Cal version of Mr. Garrison.

name: nucleargeranium
text: Teodor is fixing up his boat in the first panel.

name: xiaomimi
text:
Today's Blogs

Philippe: I am sorry that I did not blog!
Mr. Bear: Blasted Patrick
Onstad: Some observations on the day.
Little Nephew: I want to work on a ship!

You know, I missed a lot of the Little Nephew blog storylines the first time through because his old design was so eye-bleedingly unreadable - like, green text on orange or some crazy like that. He joined the Merchant Marines apparently?

name: tekende
text: I never read LN's blogs because I can't understand a thing he says.

name: mattylite
text:
You don't need to understand them to enjoy signoffs such as:
Squeeze a nerd and get a turd, word.
Watch your noggins, Kenny Loggins.
Touch a creek, freak.
That's all, shaved ball.

name: i_love_kate
text: I love his precociousness in this one. Almost Philippine, if still presented in his "street" lingo. I had to stifle an "aw."

name: deusoma
text: This brings up an important question: Why the hell does Arthur hang out with Pat? For that matter, apart from smoking Mr. Gary's pole, why does he go to anger management?

name: tekende
text: I don't think Arthur attends, I think he works there. Mr. Gary's assistant or something.

name: fineoakstructure
text: It's odd, isn't it?  I've always figured that he was a member of the group, maybe a tenured guy who was pretty much over his problems and stuck around to help the new kids.  I think Mr. Gary uses Arthur's weaknesses (1. a now renewed and overactive trust in authority figures, like counselors or maybe even mayors, perhaps even a strong attraction to them; 2. Pole smokin' jones) for his own benefit (1. not having to actually counsel and getting Arthur do his work for him; 2. beautiful acts of love from the sandpaper-esque tongue of a cat).

name: laserblade
text: Jesus dude are you a Lisp programmer

name: fineoakstructure
text: I have no idea what you're talking about.

name: laserblade
text: Because of all the parentheses.  Yeah, never mind.

name: zaratustra
text: whenever you talk like that I feel like I'm sitting on the nozzle of a canister that reads LAMBDA

name: fermatprime
text: Baby, you can drive my cdr.

name: tellumo
text:
Dude, come on, I mean those parentheses weren't even nested. You gotta go at least three levels deep before you get accused of Lisp.

(I've never used Lisp, but I think it sounds pretty cool. I mean, you gotta love a language where you can write a parser for it in a lunch hour.)

(Would you believe that in real life, I am actually a (ok, admittedly, a very geeky) lawyer ?)

name: i_love_kate
text: Is anyone else really scared of Anger after what Arthur said?

name: sp1derbaby
text: I had to get a padlock fitted. Hurts like hell.

name: endoftheworld
text: I guess the FCC doesn't monitor Achewood's radio stations, otherwise KWDA would have some fat fuckin' fines for Pat's salty language.

name: greenkoolayd
text: most stations have a delay so they can edit calls, should it ever arise.

name: tragicone
text: I just realized. this is the boat Teodor and ray fixed up. Awesome work, 'stad

name: johnnybaverage
text: I can hear Onstad barely suppressing a giggle as he wrote that alt text.
